page.title: 13 FORESTRY IN BERE FERRERS
page.content: Years ago the woodland that is now Fountain Forestry was owned by the Tavistock monks. Most of the trees are Douglas Fir and Norway Spruce;there are a few Japanese Larch and Sycamore.Webber's Wood used to be Spindle trees,but all that it is good for is firewood.It has been cut and resown with Douglas Fir.There used to be a nursery in Webbers Wood.The forest is nine hundred metres long,it has deer,fox,badgers and other mammals living in it. Sycamore and other copse trees are pruned at 5 years and felled at 12yrs. for tree and fencing stakes,as are fir and spruce sometimes.Lumberjacks spray felled trees with a chemical to stop them from rotting.The Forestry Manager is a conservationist and tries to prevent individual trees from being destroyed needlessly.
